articles.description: Former Louisiana-Lafayette OL O'Cyrus Torrence, who was an All-Sun Belt selection the last two years, will be reunited with Gators coach Billy Napier after committing to transferring to Florida.
articles.headline: Former Louisiana-Lafayette offensive lineman O'Cyrus Torrence to transfer to Florida Gators

images.name: cfp trophy [608x342] - Copy
images.caption: A proposal to expand the College Football Playoff has hit repeated roadblocks.

images.name: 210721 acc phillips photo [608x342]
images.caption: ACC commissioner Jim Phillips believes that "now is not the right time to expand the College Football Playoff."

images.name: What's next for the path to CFP expansion?
images.caption: Greg McElroy and Heather Dinich discuss how the committee can eventually come to an agreement and approve a deal for CFP expansion.

articles.description: Seven months and nine in-person meetings after revealing the proposal that was initially applauded, those who created the CFP expansion plan and publicized it have been unable to implement it.

categories.description: topic for all college football playoff content

articles.headline: Inside the College Football Playoff expansion stalemate, and what comes next

article.description: Freshman Devin Abrams rushed for 118 yards and two touchdowns and Furman pulled away in the second half to defeat Chattanooga 35-20 on Saturday.

video.headline: Furman RB somehow emerges from pile to score TD
video.caption: Furman RB Devin Abrams looks to be bottled up, but escapes the pile and puts the cherry on top for the Paladins with a 31-yard score.
video.description: Furman RB Devin Abrams looks to be bottled up, but escapes the pile and puts the cherry on top for the Paladins with a 31-yard score.

tracking.trackingName: NCF_One-Play (Furman RB somehow emerges from pile to score TD) 2019/11/02 ESHEET

video.title: Furman RB somehow emerges from pile to score TD

article.headline: Abrams, Furman run past Chattanooga 35-20

images.name: Furman RB somehow emerges from pile to score TD
images.caption: Furman RB Devin Abrams looks to be bottled up, but escapes the pile and puts the cherry on top for the Paladins with a 31-yard score.

article.story: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. -- Freshman Devin Abrams rushed for 118 yards and two touchdowns and Furman pulled away in the second half to defeat Chattanooga 35-20 on Saturday. It was all Chattanooga early. The Mocs used Victor Ulmo's 23-yard field goal to grab a 3-0 lead after one quarter. Nick Tiano scored on a 3-yard run with 12:27 left in the second quarter, but Ulmo missed the point-after kick, leaving Chattanooga with a 9-0 lead. Furman (6-3, 5-1 Southern Conference) bounced back with two touchdowns over a 2:03 span. Abrams bulled his way into the end zone from 1 yard out, capping a 10-play, 58-yard drive. Hamp Simpson then put together a 10-play, 80-yard drive for the Paladins. The freshman quarterback completed 4 of 7 passes on the drive and used his legs to cover the final 28 yards, scoring on an 8-yard run for a 14-9 lead. Chattanooga (4-5, 3-2) pulled within 14-12 at the half on Ulmo's 32-yard field goal. Sisson's 32-yard scoring strike to Ryan Miller was the only score of the third quarter, giving Furman a 21-12 lead. Abrams' 1-yard TD run pushed Furman's advantage to 28-12, but Tiano answered with a 4-yard scoring toss to Chris James and a 2-point conversion pass to James to get the Mocs within 28-20 with 6:02 remaining. Furman ran all but 6 seconds off the clock on its final possession. The Paladins kept the drive alive on a fourth-and-1 run by Abrams on their own 37-yard line and ended matters when Abrams ran 31 yards for a TD on fourth-and-2. Ailym Ford ran for 179 yards on 21 carries for Chattanooga.

videos.headline: Furman RB somehow emerges from pile to score TD
videos.description: Furman RB Devin Abrams looks to be bottled up, but escapes the pile and puts the cherry on top for the Paladins with a 31-yard score.

tracking.trackingName: NCF_One-Play (Furman RB somehow emerges from pile to score TD) 2019/11/02 ESHEET
